ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great class, easy to do well, a fun time.

The course provides a general and diverse but detailed overview of the various technologies currently involved in the biotechnology industry. I would recommend the course to another student as the course is up-to-date and contains emerging technologies that a PhD student like myself might be interested in applying to his/her research.
I would strongly recommend this class to a fellow student.

I definitely would recommend this to another student. However, since the class covers a very broad topic in biotechnology, so it might disappoint those who wants in depth knowledge on particular biotechnology advancement.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It taught me some new techniques.

The course covers up-to-date emerging and conventionally used technologies in the field of biotechnology and was very detailed and informative. The course introduces various genetic engineering techniques which I would like to adapt to my own research.
Survey of current biotechnologies expanded my scope of graduate research.
